roleset.name: to win over

example.name: transitive
example.text: Pakistan 's Bhutto defeated the first no - confidence motion in the nation 's 42 - year history , surviving the vote that could have brought down her 11 - month - old government .

propbank.arg: the first no - confidence motion in the nation 's 42 - year history
surviving the vote that could have brought down her 11 - month - old government

example.name: passive
example.text: The clutter of the 1940s remains , but its color has drained away , and the will to overcome has been defeated .

example.name: transitive with adverbials
example.text: He defeated the contentious Mr. Koch in the Democratic primary partly because he seemed to offer hope he could heal the city 's racial and ethnic wounds .

propbank.arg: partly because he seemed to offer hope he could heal the city 's racial and ethnic wounds

example.name: arg1 and LOC
example.text: an unusual parliamentary defeat for the ruling party

example.name: Odd arg 0
example.text: Potential candidates may be discouraged from running less by the congressional salary than by the prospect of defeat at the hands of a Democratic opponent .

propbank.arg: at the hands of a Democratic opponent

example.name: Arg 1 and loc once more
example.text: His defeat in last month 's presidential election

roleset.note: DEFEAT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'defeat' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from defeat.01-v)
DEFEAT-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to 'defeat.01-v'. No VN class. FN class beat_opponent. Framed by Katie. (from defeat.01-n)
